website_summaries.verdict: Luxury fidget cube toy that even comes with safety certification.
pros: Handheld cube has met and exceeded ASTM International Toy Safety Standard
Smooth surface and curved edges are easy on hands and light on wrist and arms
Sturdy – made of premium ABS plastic blocks
One-year warranty with 100% money back guarantee
cons: Just a small percentage of complaints about product quality, such as parts breaking too fast

customer_reviews.title: Best product for fidgeting on the market --- hands down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 20 year old son who has had ADD for most of his life. I have bought him fidget cubes and spinners. He used them for a while and then either lost them or grew tired of them. His reaction to the Infinity Cube is very different. The product has a solid feel and he is able to manipulate it one-handed. It helps him to concentrate when he is doing school work and studying for finals. It also seems to significantly reduce his anxiety. I can't thank you enough for this product. I wish we would have had it years ago. But I will be grateful for it now.
customer_reviews.author: jax

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap, nice heft
customer_reviews.text: After recently purchasing a more inexpensive product and believing it was the same in a bulk pack, I realized (1) just how good this product was and (2) that you must always be aware of the seller. Unlike the cheap plastic ones that are less expensive, this has a nice construction and heft. They are more durable, the hinges are better, and it is a more gratifying cube. The nice thing is it's not the price of the fancier ones, but it does feel luxurious and well crafted.
customer_reviews.author: Magila

customer_reviews.title: I cant put it down!!
customer_reviews.text: I work for a larger company and I am responsible for 12 employees under me. I have at all times at least 4 to 5 stress balls and fidget gadgets at my desk. These help me overcome the anxiety of 12 people asking me questions all day long about state and federal regulations. This cube is by far my favorite and I have not put it down since I got it. Shipping was super fast and the Small Fish company owner personally emails you to make sure you are happy with your product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M

customer_reviews.title: Well-made gadget that fidgety son loves!
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the small package fool you - this little cube packs a big punch! My son has burned through fidget cubes and spinners, you name it . . . so I was looking for something different and the Infinity Cube did NOT disappoint! He carries it in his pocket now and whips it out all the time, constantly flipping it around into different "stations" as he calls it. The way it folds into itself is crazy and super addicting! I have even found myself messing with it when he's not looking. Plus, it's relatively quiet, which is nice. Really great little toy and I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Oh heck yeah,..this is fun. Well designed and constructed with fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: This looked different and cool and not a "spinner", which is something I was sorta looking for. So I see this and order it and the shipping was very fast, the quality of the product, small-detail, is excellent and its fun to mess with...do it one way it folds outside-in,...turn it over then you have to master inside-out.....then if your hands are large enough(adult or adolescents ) you can try to get fast at the movements one-handed...then both hands one-handed....which still after a month is still fun to pick up and mindlessly fidget with..or think through some issue...it helps. love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleMike

customer_reviews.title: In case you were expecting a black cube...
customer_reviews.text: You may not get one. I figured that's what I'd get, since that's all they show, they make no mention of other colors or that you may get sent a random color or anything. There's absolutely nothing wrong with my cube. I just hate lime green, the color I got. Black is my favorite color. It's a lame gripe, but there was no warning and the product (and customer review) pictures gave me the very strong impression I would get a black cube. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: darkantoinette

customer_reviews.title: Fun to play with but...
customer_reviews.text: The label says it's new but it doesn't look new, mine is cracked at some of the hinges and also has some scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: I am not often this disapointted by an Amazon purchase.
customer_reviews.text: There were several things about this product that did not meet my expectations. 1. I ordered a black cube and received a neon green cube. 2. It is constructed of cheap plastic. 3. The hinges are loose. 4. The action is rough and often catches. 5. It is smaller then it appears in the photos. You can find cubes of similar quality at the Dollar Tree or 99 Cent store.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great for a young fidgeter
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my son (age 11) who always wants something to mess with in his hand and we as parents want because otherwise he picks at his fingers and fingernails. Very sturdy, often my son works a fidget so hard it starts to breakdown and lose its workability quickly. The Infinity Cube has held up well. Also, there is almost no sound while fidgeting; other fidgets can make sounds that are distracting and annoying to others. Quality product that I would order again and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: ehoward29

customer_reviews.title: Does not feel like a quality item.
customer_reviews.text: To be honest I spent a few extra buck because the amount of positive reviews. Apparently this does not reflect a greater quality product. Looks be be the same cheap version you can get else were on amazon. The one I received feels pretty flimsy and very loose. Wobbly and awkward to manipulate. Maybe save a few bucks and get the less expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Great For Fidgeting.. Not Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: I really like this toy. The texture is great and it's a lot of fun to play with. EDIT: Well, I liked the toy. Unfortunately, after a month of use it broke completely. I'm not an aggressive fidgeter and I never dropped it. Oh well, our time together was nice while it lasted. RIP Fidget Cube 2019.
customer_reviews.author: CE

customer_reviews.title: Quality fidget, well made and quiet
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 12 year old son. He has severe anxiety and ADD and this cube is amazing. He can sit there and play with it quietly in his class but also bring it home and get ambitious about all the ways it turns and switches blocks around. He normally uses fidget cubes or rubix cubes but those are a distraction to the other students around him. I even found myself holding it a couple of evenings to fidget while thinking about some work I was doing (helps keep my hands busy instead of snacking 😁)! We will be buying more of these for our other kids and probably my husband and myself as well!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca O.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just noisy
customer_reviews.text: When I first started messing with it, I had trouble getting the rhythm down and didn't think it would work for me. However, once I got the motion down, I really started to enjoy it. It keeps my hand busy and calms my mind down a little. The downsides I have with it: it's noisy. It's not something I can take into a public, more quiet setting, and feel comfortable using. Which is when I really need something. And the hinges seem to already be loosening maybe too much, which makes me think it won't have good longevity. We will see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: amberliegh

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this fidget cube
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old son has had this for over a month now and it's holding up nicely. He keeps it in his school backpack and says he plays with it almost every day. He's very happy with this cube.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyPisos

customer_reviews.title: Addictive but didn’t hold up long.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my desk to entertain my coworkers when they came to chat and me as I was brainstorming. I’ve got a touch of ADHD. ;) everyone loved it. It was pretty addictive and moved really well. The problem was it only lasted a month or two. One of the hinges cracked and then broke apart pretty quickly. Since it was in the office it’s not like it was treated roughy. I was really sad that it died so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany W.

customer_reviews.title: Super fun fidgeting
customer_reviews.text: Such a great fidget toy. I can use this with one hand and it's not distracting, but does help me focus. I find that the fidget spinners end up distracting me more than anything else. It did arrive a little scratched and is kind of loud for an office environment, but people don't seem to mind as I work in a busy office.
customer_reviews.author: scarletandwhite

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability and quality
customer_reviews.text: It was a good toy at first but mine just broke really quickly, the quality feels very cheap and not worth the price
customer_reviews.author: KZ1221

customer_reviews.title: Of the non-metal infinity cubes, this is the best quality I've found
customer_reviews.text: Of the non-metal infinity cubes I've purchased, this is the best quality I've found. The pieces fall and flow smoothly and easily and don't catch. I've given these as gifts and I'd have to say I prefer them to the metal one I have at least in terms of smoothness which is helps with one handed butterfly knife type flicking, flipping -- and dropping... because I'm no where as good as someone I saw on the internets (all the twitters, I know 'em) Of the ones I've received (5?) they were all shiny, and scratch-free unlike the one or two I've read about.
customer_reviews.author: zentype

customer_reviews.title: Really cool toy. I fidget a lot
customer_reviews.text: Really cool toy. I fidget a lot, so when I received this product I was excited, I've been playing with my fidget spinner too long and wanted something new to try. Played with the Infinity Cube for about 20 minutes straight. Was pretty satisfying, it fits in the hand well and its super fun to twirl while you brainstorm. I'll be purchasing another one because my dog ate it to bits immediately after I set it down and went to take a shower. Yay. But it was awesome while it lasted. 5/5 stars for the cube, 2/5 stars for the husky.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Brock Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this to keep on my desk to play with when I'm on the phone. I have a spinner, but that takes two hands, and a couple times I've accidentally thrown the spinner across the room. With this one you only need one hand. It's plastic and I'm not sure how durable it would be for a kid who plays rough, but for me it's fine. And it's not good for small children who could swallow the pieces if it fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: Daci Jett

customer_reviews.title: The plastic pieces where the cube is anchored falls off
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Cube is broken. I'll start by saying that I absolutely loved this cube when I received it. It helps with my ADD and anxiety, and I can focus without fidgeting with random items. About a week after I recieved the cube little plastic pieces started to chip off. As of today, 5 of the corners have chipped pieces with the little metal pieces inside exposed. I still love the cube but it's not as visually appealing any more so I would recommend going with a more durable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Joylynn Moore

customer_reviews.title: Not a sturdy toy
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really sure why this is labelled "luxury," but it's a soft plastic toy. It does move easily, and has a satisfying "clack," but after the first evening playing the product is already showing serious wear. The caps holding the cubes together are starting to separate. It's a great concept, but the product is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for fidgeting
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Infinity Cube. It's great for keeping my hands occupied and my brain focused on my task. My concern is the noise. It's not a huge amount of noise but it is still audible to others. In my office it is fine but I also attend classes and training sessions. At least one person has mentioned that they found the noise distracting to them. It's better than clicking a pen or whatnot but can still be heard. I took one star away for that fact but it's personally very beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: coales

customer_reviews.title: Great sollution to an 8 year problem.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent fidget cube. Anxiety and wiggles are under control in the back seat of my car, now!
customer_reviews.author: chablis

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, fell apart after a few weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: The blocks are held together by a series of hinges and the pins are held in place by small rectangualr fasteners. I have never dropped this nor twisted it as a child might but two of the tiny black fasteners are gone and I've had it less than a month. I would not recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Rhys L.

customer_reviews.title: Great fidget toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best fidget toys we've ever purchased. I got this for my husband who sits on long calls for work. It's much more interactive than a fidget spinner, and much more satisfying! My son has "borrowed" it several times because he loves to play with it. I would highly recommend this for anyone who feels the need to fidget or wiggle. It does make noise when the cubes click together, but it's not loud enough to hear over the phone (kind of sounds like the clicking of a pen), so it may not be great in a classroom/church setting, but definitely everywhere else!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Loved how well this worked for me to fidget with, but splurge on one that isn't made of plastic. Had it for two weeks and a couple of the "joints" broke and made the whole thing come apart. Definitely not what you want when you have to use it almost constantly
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Nice fidget
customer_reviews.text: A nice, well made fidget. Attractively packaged. I got it for my 10 year old son to use in class. It's a little too large for use in a boy's pocket but it's quiet and fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Danabee

customer_reviews.title: Says it is his favorite (and he has several) - and his mother (my ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson's 9th birthday and he LOVES it! Says it is his favorite (and he has several) - and his mother (my daughter) says she like it too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very limited not worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thinking it was fully articulated. Instead, I find that it has limited positions. It's either flat, one side flipped to a square or both sides flipped making a square. It actually is more stress creating than stress relieving as you flip it, expecting to flip it again, but you can't
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very cool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool toy/fidget cube. My son loves it and I find myself playing with it whenever he sets it down. It seems very high quality too.
customer_reviews.author: boo

customer_reviews.title: Fun but plastic feel annoys me
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy getting my Infinity Cube. When i received my package i was very surprised how small the box was. I started to play with the infinity Cube and do have to say it is kind of fun. The part that annoys me the most is the plastic feel. It just takes a lot of he joy away. For the price i think it is worth it. If the Plastic does bother you there are other Infinity cubes made out of other material. I still would recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nzgg

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I work in Law Enforcement and come into contact with children who are in stressful situations, leading to a second patrol bag set aside and dedicated for these situations with stuffed animals, stickers and various other toys. These cubes are great for helping to soothe and calm nerves, usually being the first thing they pick to play with and keep. It’s also a big hit among coworkers to fidget with after a call to decompress.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Walden

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job of de-stressing anyone....not just kids!
customer_reviews.text: The Infinity Cube Fidget Toy arrived on time and in a nice gift box. I was surprised at how small it was, but our 16 year old grandson (who deals with anxiety) opened it and immediately began to maneuver it with both hands in several directions. His older sister, dad and mom all were intrigued and wanted to try it out. Each of them were fascinated by the ease of handling it and thought it was a cool way to de-stress!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Best Infinity Cube!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried 3 different Infinity Cubes and this one is my clear favorite; it is rigid plastic with a nice heft and tight, but easily manipulated hinges. I tried a different plastic one that was lighter weight with loosey goosey hinges and felt very cheap (I returned it). I also have some alloy ones that are decently hefty, but a bit loose feeling. This Infinity Cube from Small Fish is HIGH QUALITY and HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: Libbie Moore

customer_reviews.title: Not my thing
customer_reviews.text: I tried this out to see if it would satisfy my anxiety and maybe it would relieve some Trenton that I get when I get fidgety sometimes. For me I found that it makes my fingers tired and Fatigued From the flipping it in only some many ways. I image for someone else it might be exactly what they needed. For me not so much. I guess I will keep looking to see if I can find something that doesn’t fatigue my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: my favorite fidget
customer_reviews.text: I've tried quite a few fidget toys, and this has so far been my favorite. the quality of the build is very satisfying and it gives an overall heft to each movement that makes it feel very....fidgetable? each time you fold the blocks, there's a clack that really just soothes something in me. once I got the hang of doing it in one hand, I was 100% sold. I'm sure this is really all just down to your own personal preference, but also I'd really recommend trying it. I'm a big fan.
customer_reviews.author: marakaki

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fidget toy
customer_reviews.text: This a very nice fidget toy. It's well made, sturdy, works every time, all the time and can be handled with just one hand. I have several fidget toys and so far, this is the best one. I can play for hours while watching tv or reading. It had fallen to the floor a couple of times and it didn't break or damage. Highly recommend for fidgeters of all shapes, sizes, and ages.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Osvaldo Murgo

customer_reviews.title: Good entertainer for kids
customer_reviews.text: My son was adamant on getting a spinner cube. I searched through Amazon, and other reputed websites only to find that this is the only decent fidget toy for around $10. Did not want to spend a lot for a toy which my son may not use for long. However, to my surprise he has not lost interest in this ever since we bought it. Although it is not a real 'fidget spinner', the cube version is still attractive for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Su Geo

customer_reviews.title: a little different than what I was expecting. Would definitely buy again, and recommend to others
customer_reviews.text: Ultimately, I ordered the product with overnight shipping, it was late, got refunded without asking or wondering “is it late?”. As for the product, it has a little less adaptability than I thought. Every possible bend and fold you could think of in each direction is not possible...you may be able to bend over and touch your toes; but you certainly can’t bend over backwards to touch your heels. I would not use this in a classroom setting, a bit distracting with the clicking noises. Still a very unique product, would purchase again if anything were to go wrong. Interested in other similar products that use more sturdy materials.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Got this for myself and holy f#$& its addicting even handed it off to my friend while we were sitting at a spot waiting to turn he sat there playing with the thing for 5 minutes before he handed it back to me realizing we had missed atleast 8 oppertunities to turn lmao and it also has some medical properties i cant wait to put into practice so im definantly going to invest in atleast 2 more thank you so much for this awesome product
customer_reviews.author: David Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Collection of 8 tiny cubes smoothly transitions through 3 semi-stable shapes
customer_reviews.text: This is well-packaged and kind of cool; however, if I had played with one ahead of time, I would not have purchased it. ... It's just not really satisfying, in any way. I suspect the experience could be vastly improved by the addition of some embedded magnets -- this could make the morphing process more fun and would give it the ability to actually hold a shape.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Sawhill Aroha

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I remembered having something similar when i was younger. But it would be really flexible, so it could flex 'out of normal' range. This one barely had any shapes to make. And the plastic feel made it feel terrible in hand
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It had scratches
customer_reviews.text: I like the Fisher cube for the purpose it was intended for, to fidget. It is easy and fun to do. I however can’t do it with one hand yet, my fingers are too small! The other thing I disliked about this product was that it came scratched up. There was a white scratch on one of the black sides and one of the corners is also scratched. The white underneath shows through quote easily.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Fun, different activity to keep anyone busy.
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old twin boys received one each as birthday gift. It was easy for them to use, and they liked using it. In fact one of them took it to bed so he could wake up in the morning to use. They already figured out how to do it with one hand, on the first day. It is small, which is a good thing. The size allows various age users to use it one handed. My husband happened to come across it on Amazon, we are very happy with our purchase. I would recommend it for a unique little gift.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Cool Cube!
customer_reviews.text: My wife likes fidget devices and I got her this cube for Christmas. She loves it! The only negative thing I can say about it is that it clicks a little when you play with it, making this possibly a little more annoying to non-fidgety bystanders than other devices out there. If you (or those around you) are moderately tolerant, though, you'll be okay. This also scores bonus points if the recipient is a Star Trek fan — you can call it a Borg cube.
customer_reviews.author: Book Gnome

customer_reviews.title: Durable, easy to use, but noisy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 6yr old who has a hard time sitting still for google meets he has to do for school. It does make a clacking sound, but with his mic off and holding it under the table no-one notices he’s using it. I wouldn’t send to in-person classes (his school is hybrid right now) due to the noise it makes. Otherwise is it made well and serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Crudo

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Basically folds in two directions - nothing much you can do with it. Linkage is rather sloppy - not a precision item.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce S.

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged, arrived quickly. I ordered this for my son who suffers from anxiety. He requested a fidget cube and this one appealed to me with it's sleek design. He's away at university and I'll be sending this to him in a care package soon.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda's World

customer_reviews.title: Great for children who have ADHD and Tourret’s Syndrome
customer_reviews.text: My son has ADHD Combined- Impulsivity and Tourret’s Syndrome. He needs to move A LOT and has impulse urges as well. This helps him take his brain off of impulses not 100% because you cannot ever fully control an impulsive brain but it helps relieve the NEED (adhd impulsivity and TS mommas understand the “need”) for it. It’s durbale and doesn’t make noise and is small so they can use during class. I’ve inserted this fidget in my son’s IEP so thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Kris L

customer_reviews.title: Simple, sleek, neat, quality. Very nice product.
customer_reviews.text: It's great for people that mindlessly shift their hand while watching something or sitting at their desk. Also makes a great stocking stuffer. The sellers reached out to me to ask how I felt about the product and they were so very kind. (As a side note, my boyfriend found that it makes a really good desk photo holder for instax photographs)
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, calms anxiety. Very small size.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my nephew. He has a little bit of anxiety and since the fidget spinners are now passe, I thought this might help him. He actually LOVES it and can’t stop playing with it. He says he doesnt even understand why its so fun and addictive. Either way, he’s happy and calmer with it. Know that the cube is VERY, VERY small.
customer_reviews.author: PoleMonkeys309

customer_reviews.title: Great diversion!
customer_reviews.text: I want to improve my speed on this! 1) From the 2x2x2 cube state, you can fold down two fourths to get a 2x4. 2) Fold this on the long edge to get another 2x4. 3) Fold it in half to get back to the 2x2x2. Right now I average about 45 cycles per minute. Planning on doubling that. Or you can do it in reverse. I'm slower at it in reverse. The hardest part is the step that requires two folds. I still call it one step because they are symmetric. I'm just getting started but I want to spend many hours mastering it.
customer_reviews.author: Corey P. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: "Best Fidget Device Ever"
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 20-year-old daughter, and she couldn't put it down for two days! She says it's the best fidget device she's had. It feels so good. Plenty of people wanted to have a crack at it, and everyone thought it was so cool!
customer_reviews.author: hometeacher

customer_reviews.title: Looks sturdy but didnt survive one drop
customer_reviews.text: I bought the cube last week and it is a great toy! But my daughter dropped it on our hardwood floor today and there is a crack for one of the small connectors. I didnt expect that to happen since the toy looks very sturdy! How can I get a replacement piece for the small connector?
customer_reviews.author: NanaBaby

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy thus far,  but slightly larger than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Got here right on time. Cube is about what I expected it to be, though it is a bit larger than expected. My hands are fairly small, so it makes using many fidget items hard to use. Still, I can use this one, even if it's not particularly comfortable. Otherwise, great item! Gift to people who have normal sized hands, heh!
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my teenage son. Like many anxious, sensory seeking people, he needs stress relief. This is great! He liked the weight and commented that it was a "cool cube." In teenage language, that means mom did good! Thank you to this small company for a nice product, and for reaching out to ensure customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Squishy Wood

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for ADHD
customer_reviews.text: My son has an immensely hard time focusing and will pick at his face when distracted. He has used this cube for two weeks now, at home and in school, and his face is almost healed. This is a lifesaver for my ADHD teen.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas Gift!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for an adult family member and it was well received. The infinity cube is a very cool and unique fidget toy and is a great alternative for those who might benefit from a fidget toy but aren't interested in the "spinners" all the "kids" are "playing" with. It's great for use in an office environment and shaking some cobwebs loose on a Monday morning (or passing time during those oh so productive staff meetings your boss likes to hold). Solid, durable design -- it has enough weight that it doesn't feel flimsy and cheap and it is not too heavy to sit in your pocket. Works well, no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, Plastic-y, Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Gift it to someone you don't like. The hinges are loose, the whole thing is hollow, and it's made from cheap plastic. The cube I ordered was the black edition; it arrived faded and grey-looking. It crumpled like paper when I tried to play with it. Threw it in the trash and forgot about it.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Little
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than expected. Makes a good figet for pocket keeping. I did not check measurements before buying. Bought as a Gift and because of size was underwheming even with nice packaging. Not manufacturers fault, I should have checked... but if you are looking for pocket sized it’s very nice. A little loud and clanky when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T.

customer_reviews.title: It's a fidget, but nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: This is quality and it works fine, but there's not much fidget to it. It does make a clicking sound so I don't take it to the office where I kind of need it the most, but it is something to do with your hands. It just seems like it goes one direction or reverse of that. There's no real fiddling with it other than sort of rolling it around and around.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey L. Carty

customer_reviews.title: This Cube is Best
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a couple of different Infinity Cubes. This one is by far the best. It has a good weight, glides smoothly, and feels like it's well made. The other ones I ordered are cheap, they don't flow well, and feel light and fragile. If you want a good infinity cube you need to order this one. This company ships quickly and has a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: started to break within 1 week of use
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised to be writing this based on other reviews but within 1 week of light use during work the links that hold it together started to break. It became very loose and I think within another week it would have completely broken down. Only reason I dont give it 1 star is because I really enjoyed using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a whim for my 10 yr old who constantly has his fingers in his mouth. It works beautifully to keep his hands busy, especially while watching tv. Movement is smooth and easy, unlike similar fidgets I've tried. Now I want one! Great seller, would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: cxmackwev

customer_reviews.title: Best fidget toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is very fun to fidget with, my Son LOVES it! He has many different fidget “toys” but this is by far his very favorite. I highly recommend this to help anyone that has a hard time sitting still, it keeps their hands busy and helps them concentrate and focus. Great company also, customer service is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy but inconsistent quality.
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy, but the quality is lacking. On the first one I received, there was a small crack in one of the hinges so I asked for a replacement. The replacement doesn’t have any cracks, but one of the hinges doesn’t move smoothly, so it’s not fun to play with. I’m going to return the second one and keep the one with the crack.
customer_reviews.author: hikerjen

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying, Durable, High-Quality, Clackity
customer_reviews.text: This product is very durable, I have dropped it several times from a height of 3ft onto a hard laminate floor, with NO DAMAGE at all. It has a very satisfying clack/click to it when its being used. It moves very easily and smoothly. It is plastic, with metal hinges (covered by non-removable plastic caps) but has decent weight to it. It is extremely easy to use one-handed. I'm even using it as I write this. It is very satisfying, stress-relieving and helps with your train of thought. It is also great for hands that can't stay still and like to be busy. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Curry Family

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made?
customer_reviews.text: As a fidget item, it's not very exciting. Just flip flop some cubes. Also seems very flimsy. I expect it will break relatively soon after I give it to my grandson. I could send it back, but don't want to bother with that hassle and expense. Should have taken the advice of some of the posts before I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: mathislife

customer_reviews.title: Great figit toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a stocking stuffer for oldest son and it's become a favorite toy for the whole family. Seems someone is always playing with it. It provides mindless entertainment helps to keep the hands busy. It is durable and seems like it isn't going to break anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Krise

customer_reviews.title: The plastic joints in this come apart easily especially if it is dropped
customer_reviews.text: The plastic joints in this come apart easily especially if it is dropped. Kids love these but kids drop things. We are purchasing a second one because they loved it so much but the first one only lasted a few days before it was dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: It helps
customer_reviews.text: So you have some feedback from a kid I will share of how I think of the infinity cube.It defiantly helps me calm down and focus I love that it only goes certain ways so you can know the physics behind it and even though I used the word physics I am not a nerd I'm athletic #feedbackfromakid
customer_reviews.author: Chad A ortman

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend & I are always fidgeting with things, or looking for quick ways to stay occupied during small amounts of time without always being on our cell phones. This infinity cube was exactly what we needed! I bought one before heading down to the lake for the week, & whenever we were waiting for everyone else to get ready or had any down time for a few minutes, I would look over & see my guy fidgeting with this. Such a great product! It's high quality, very durable, easy to use, entertaining, & very affordable as well! Will definitely be placing an order for myself very soon! Thanks! :)
customer_reviews.author: Oli

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 months, but replaced for free.
customer_reviews.text: I received this the end of February, and it lasted just two months before the hinges self-destructed. It has never been forced or roughly treated. Up until it broke I very much enjoyed if as a fidget thing on my desk. UPDATE: Based on my initial poor review of this product, the seller reached out and arranged for a free replacement. Very impressed by their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Limvere

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, and hours of fun for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these after my 7 and 9 year-old boys had a chance to play with someone else's infinity cube and loved it. Since they're is no puzzle-solving involved, it's a great toy to keep their hands and brains occupied instead of looking at a screen or playing a video game. The construction is solid, and it feels nice in your hands-not too heavy or light, and not rough. I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product was great. The sellers of this product really care about offering the best quality. They have messaged me to make sure the product arrived safely and worked great. Which it did both. I bought it for my boyfriend who has ADHD. So far he loves it. It’s not the most quiet fidget toy. But it really is a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Davis

customer_reviews.title: Not SUPER durable
customer_reviews.text: I had mine for about 2 weeks. Granted, I used the crap out of it. It's really nice for keeping my hands busy but it fell apart after a couple of weeks. EDIT: seller contacted me and sent me a new one. Took 'em a while to do that but I like the product and that they made things right so I'm bumping from 2 stars to 4.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great for busy hands
customer_reviews.text: My husband cannot keep his hands still when he is thinking. The drumming of fingers on his desk and the constant tapping was beginning to drive me up the wall. This has been a nice solution to both our problems. It isn't completely silent, but is quiet enough to ignore from the next room.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for an adult
customer_reviews.text: This has helped me stay focused a little better and helps with aimless thinking that leads me to eating out of boredom. My daughter got a hold of it though and dropped it and now its really loose. Still works bits feels like it might fall apart in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened the box and took the cube out, a black plastic piece that covers a hinge fell off, clearly broken. After playing with it for not even 30 seconds, another piece fell off, also clearly broken. The cube still works as intended, but the missing black clips for the hinges allow the hinges to slip out. UPDATE: The covers over the hinges continue to fall off. Downgraded to 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: marsha williams

customer_reviews.title: NOT Mom friendly!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is NOT SILENT....CLICK....CLICK....CLICK..... causes almost instant anxiety in this Mama!!! My daughter loves it but it does her no good if it makes her Mama anxious. There are plenty of fidget toys that she loves that actually are wonderfully silent, which is a win win for both of us :-) Luckily, her dad has "typical Dad ears", so this fidget toy is getting sent over there tomorrow. I'm only giving this 2 stars because the product description says it is "noiseless". Bottom line....only get this if you need a fidget toy that makes noise.
customer_reviews.author: CSA Crazy

customer_reviews.title: Good for fidgeting, but poorly constructed with sometimes sharp corners.
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered a total of seven of these because they're addictive. They do come apart rather easily though and occasionally have (very) sharp corners. The last one I used I had to file down after cutting myself. Time to find a new fidget toy I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Powers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use fidget. Seems well made.
customer_reviews.text: Well made cube. Great for fidgeting. Many reviewers say it's good for one handed use. My daughter and I both have long fingers and we found it awkward to use with one hand...maybe with some practice?? It's basically a 2 handed fidget in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: DaisyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, Great for one-handed fidgeting, Looks great on your desk!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to find how perfectly this fits in my hand - a perfect size. A lot of fun to keep on my desk as an art piece, but also use to fidget with one hand while working. Really happy to have this -- it's a lot better than my stress ball :) The only reason my overall rating is four stars is because the material (described as metal aluminum) appears and feels to be more like a hard plastic, and while I'd still like a metal fidget cube, the material doesn't take away at all from how I enjoy using it. Thanks for a cool product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: PRETTY good but, :/
customer_reviews.text: I got this infinity cube and was in perfect shape, though it took a few minutes to get used to i think it was very good quality. it was smooth and unique but was BLACK!!! i though it would look good when you hold it but it looks like a lump of coal. i think it was good but there are some flaws.
customer_reviews.author: D. Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep hands busy
customer_reviews.text: My son thoroughly enjoys this fidget. While it does make some noise, it isn’t a distraction to those around - and just enough of a distraction for those with ADHD.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: It engages the mind!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a counselor at a school and I was looking for a fidget that would keep my students busy but at the same time engage their minds. So far, no complaints. Each of my students have been fascinated with the infinity cube and have created different shapes with it. It keeps them busy and helps to calm them down. I would definitely purchase this product again because it engages young minds and helps them to settle down in a constructive way.
customer_reviews.author: Zainab Sadiq

customer_reviews.title: Fun little distraction
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this as something of a "gag gift", but it's very satisfying to play with and seems well made. I enjoy absent-mindedly fiddling with it, and would definitely recommend it as an alternative to fidget spinners and other "toys".
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wood

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, plasticky, but it works
customer_reviews.text: Largely disappointed by this little thing... I expected the blocks to align with a magnetic snap for some reason, but they're just lightweight plastic that you can move around on your own. They also make a bit of noise as you rearrange the block and the joints feel like they could break easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Lash

customer_reviews.title: Works well and I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: While I can't get super specific, I work in a trauma-related counseling field. Clients use this while we talk about trauma. They report that it really helps them feel less anxious. I highly recommend it. :) Also, shipped quickly, arrived in great condition, and it's very neat.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: cute
customer_reviews.text: obsessed with the idea and aesthetics, but it bends in less ways that i expected. also i dunno why i thought it would be metal, but its plastic. and quite loud when you’re fidgeting with it, but for the price honestly i cant complain. it’s still a cool little thing!!
customer_reviews.author: Juno Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Great fidget toy for kids & adults
customer_reviews.text: I recently started experiencing some anxiety issues and was looking for something to use when those symptoms arise, especially when I'm at work. I gave this a shot and have been very pleased with it. It keeps my fingers/hands busy and I'm able to keep my mind occupied with just moving the pieces around. My one complaint is that I've only had it for about a week and the hinges seem very loose; it hasn't broken, but I don't know if it will stand the test of time. I would still recommend it as it has seemed to help me. My kids keep taking it when I'm at home, too.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Wilson

customer_reviews.title: This Toy Soothes This Adults Mind
customer_reviews.text: I sit at a desk in front of a computer all day. It’s crazy to me how just the simple movements of this toy soothes this adults mind. This is my second purchase and this cube seems even more durable than the last. After some use they feel even better to manipulate. Great stress reliever.
customer_reviews.author: Valtron

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I received my infinity cube super fast. I love that it fits in my hand when I am busy during my daily life. I notice it helps me center my focus when there are many distractions around me. Overall I would highly recommend this fidget toy to anyone children or adults who suffer from Add or some sort of focusing dissability.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Erpenbach

customer_reviews.title: Small hands
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to help her anxiety and fidgeting, but it ended up being a little bigger than she felt comfortable with. I gave it a shot and it was pretty neat. I, too, have small hands though. It's a little bulky for me, but I still absolutely love the concept and think it's the best fidget tool/toy that I have seen yet.
customer_reviews.author: pen name

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased two infinity cubes for my special needs twin granddaughters, and after playing with those, decided that I should have one of my own! It is great! Visitors pick it up and can't put it down; I tell them where to buy their own!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Lucinda

customer_reviews.title: Great fidget toy
customer_reviews.text: Way better than a fidget spinner in my book. Just zone out and do repeated sequences or seemingly random movements. It is mostly plastic but has a good weight to it, you can really feel it in your hand(s) which helps the effect. The real subtle clicking of the cubes hitting eachother may become irritating to others but I like it, not too quiet or loud. Hinges seem solid (for their purpose), although I’ve only had mine for a couple weeks, will be interesting to see how they hold up to repeated use. Great stocking stuffer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little item
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 yr old ... boy ... hyper ... pen pal as his end of year gift. I played with it and it felt solid and sturdy, not plastic like at all. Moved very smoothly and was quiet. My thoughts were that this might keep a little boy's hands busy when he is supposed to be sitting still without disrupting others.
customer_reviews.author: tbishop99

customer_reviews.title: Great item for those with ADHD or Autism.
customer_reviews.text: Cube is excellent for my child with ADHD and autism. It does a great job with helping to calm and refocus and is a great distraction for transitioning to different task. I ordered one for my child , then one for his teacher who was very impressed and wanted one for the classroom and later another for a cousin with ADHD, I am looking forward to more of your products.
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Fun to play with but fell apart
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this when I got it, and I played with it a lot. Unfortunately, within about two weeks the plastic hinges cracked and fell off, and the metal pins holding it together came out. I don't think it would be safe for children to have these sharp pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca D. Gold

product_meta.title: Infinity Cube Fidget Toy, Sensory Tool EDC Fidgeting Game for Kids and Adults, Cool Mini Gadget Best for Stress and Anxiety Relief and Kill Time, Unique Idea that is Light on the Fingers and Hands
feature_bullets: ✔ AWESOME HANDHELD FIDGET CUBE TOY GIFT FOR FIDGETERS – Fidget like a boss. Playable with one hand. Prime fidgeting toy for little children, teens and adults. Perfect for girls, boys, women and men. Pocket-size so you can bring it to school or to the office. With its discrete and ergonomic style, it’s cool to play with and do a lot of tricks. The rivets are covered for a classier and professional look.

✔ TOP QUALITY MINI FIDGET MATERIALS WITH A SAFETY CERTIFICATE – Composed with eight (8) tough ABS plastic blocks linked together with strong stainless steel metal rivets. Durable and can withstand constant flipping and folding. It has a smooth surface and curved edges that are easy on the hands and light on the wrist and arms. It has also met and exceeded the ASTM International Toy Safety Standard and is CPSIA certified so it can be passed on to siblings and friends.

✔ ANTI-ANXIETY AND STRESS RELIEVER STRESS CUBE – A great way to release stress from school and work. Avoid nail biting, knuckle cracking, leg shaking and other fidgeting habits with the use of this gadget. It also improves your focus while studying, working or brainstorming by a simple flip and fold. It's a relaxing, noiseless, and compact tactile sensory never ending cube.

✔ ADDICTIVE AND FUN FIDGET STIMMING TOY FOR KIDS AND ADULTS– Have fun for hours while practicing and improving finger flexibility. Keep your hands and minds busy during class or work. Lessen phone and other technology induced stress. It’s a wonderful desk accessory, time killer, conversation starter and everyday carry device. Great office desk accessory when not used or played with.

✔ THE PERFECT FIDGETING TOY FOR ALL AGES – Ultimate small indoor or outdoor toy for all boys, girls, men and women, school students and office crowds. Caution: not suitable for children 3 years old and below, parental guidance for toddlers age 3-7. Give as gifts for birthdays, Christmas and other holidays as well as a get well soon gifts.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,174 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
